intro: Eleocharis oxylepis, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy environments, such as swamps and seasonally flooded areas. The plant has thin, cylindrical stems that are often clustered together, and its small, spike-like inflorescences bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Eleocharis oxylepis is characterized by its narrow leaves and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
